EmperorAD_EmperorWarning1.synopsis: AD with the Emperor when the players enter the bridge near Baldur's Gate (the gate). Second warning state. The emperor apply the players a slower status.
EmperorAD_EmperorWarning1.how_to_trigger: Enter the trigger on Baldur's Gate (the gate) bridge.

AD_RapidMelt_006.synopsis: Quick AD for the Netherbrain. In  Baldur's Gate, this AD will be shown when playes reach certain point near the gate itself.

AD_Civilian_005_011.synopsis: Behaviour AD between two civilians at the beginning of the bridge in front of Baldur's Gate (the gate).

EmperorAD_EmperorWarning2.synopsis: AD with the Emperor when the players advance through the bridge near Baldur's Gate (the gate). Second warning state. The emperor apply the players a slower status.
EmperorAD_EmperorWarning2.how_to_trigger: Reach the middle of the Baldur's Gate (the gate) bridge.

FlamingFist_Ranger_002.synopsis: Flaming Fist guarding Baldur's Gate (the gate)

FlamingFist_Melee_003.synopsis: Flaming Fist guarding Baldur's Gate (the gate)

FlamingFist_Cleric_001.synopsis: Flaming Fist guarding Baldur's Gate (the gate)

Civilian_003.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

PAD_UpperCityHunting.synopsis: Party Banter when players arrive to the road that leads to Baldur's Gate (the gate). In the road witht he trees, right after the statue in the plaza, players will trigger this VB just walking through. Astarion may or may not be a vampire lord at this point - if he is, he won't regret luring back his victims because he was able to sacrifice them to become the vampire lord

AD_RapidMelt_004.synopsis: Quick AD for the Netherbrain. In  Baldur's Gate, this AD will be shown when playes reach certain point near the gate itself.

FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor.synopsis: Dialog that activates when players try to go to Baldur's Gate (the gate).
FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor.how_to_trigger: Enter in S_LOW_BaldursGate_Lvl3Warning_18deb75c-3ff9-487a-a0be-0a016b895eb0 with an Illithid character.

AD_Civilian_010.synopsis: Behaviour AD for a human in Baldur's Gate (the gate) bridge.

FlamingFist_Melee_002.synopsis: Flaming Fist guarding Baldur's Gate (the gate)

AD_RapidMelt_005.synopsis: Quick AD for the Netherbrain. In  Baldur's Gate, this AD will be shown when playes reach certain point near the gate itself.

DoorDialog.synopsis: In Baldur's Gate (the gate), if players reach the door after the warnings we will start this dialog about voluntarely become a thrall.

Civilian_007.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

Civilian_011.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

AD_FlamingFist_Melee_001.synopsis: AD for a flaming fist in Baldur's Gate bridge, yelling people to stay in the line.

Civilian_004.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

Civilian_009.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

FlamingFist_Melee_004.synopsis: Flaming Fist guarding Baldur's Gate (the gate)

Civilian_010.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

FlamingFist_Melee_001.synopsis: Flaming Fist guarding Baldur's Gate (the gate)

PAD_AfterEmperorWarning.synopsis: PAD that will be triggered after the first Emperor Warning in Baldur's Gate
PAD_AfterEmperorWarning.how_to_trigger: Going to Baldur's Gate, the gate, and try to walk through the bridge with a tadpoled character. After the first Emperor Warning, this PAD will be triggered.

AD_Civilian_008.synopsis: Behaviour AD for one civilian in the Baldur's Gate (the gate) bridge.

FlamingFist_Caster001.synopsis: Flaming Fist guarding Baldur's Gate (the gate)

Civilian_006.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

AD_Civilian_001_002.synopsis: A couple waiting in the line to go to the Upper City in Baldur's Gate (the gate).

PAD_PsionicSupression.synopsis: Player meant to be played as VB when players reach Baldur's Gate (the gate) and feel the power of the Netherbrain.

AD_RapidMelt_001.synopsis: Quick AD for the Netherbrain. In  Baldur's Gate, this AD will be shown when playes reach certain point near the gate itself.

EmperorAD_EmperorWarning3.synopsis: AD with the Emperor when the players advance through the bridge near Baldur's Gate (the gate). Second warning state. The emperor apply the players a slower status.
EmperorAD_EmperorWarning3.how_to_trigger: Reach the final spot of the Baldur's Gate (the gate) bridge.

Civilian_005.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

EmperorAD_Brainquake.synopsis: In the brainquake near Baldur's Gate (the gate) the Emperor will warn you about go to Upper city: you will become a thrall of the absolute if you do so.

Civilian_001.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

AD_RapidMelt_003.synopsis: Quick AD for the Netherbrain. In  Baldur's Gate, this AD will be shown when playes reach certain point near the gate itself.

AD_RapidMelt_002.synopsis: Quick AD for the Netherbrain. In  Baldur's Gate, this AD will be shown when playes reach certain point near the gate itself.

Civilian_002.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

AD_FlamingFist_Cleric_001.synopsis: Sequential AD for the cleric at Baldur's Gate, the gate. She is the last one Flaming Fist between the people and the door.
AD_FlamingFist_Cleric_001.how_to_trigger: Be near S_LOW_BaldursGate_FlamingFist_Cleric_001_f61ed726-793d-4611-a234-ad5a6b487514 and wait until the behaviour.

Civilian_008.synopsis: Civilian waiting to go to Upper City

FlamingFist_Ranger_001.synopsis: Flaming Fist guarding Baldur's Gate (the gate)

EmperorAD_EmperorWarning1_0.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
EmperorAD_EmperorWarning1_0.text: Listen to me - if you go any further, the brain will dominate us. We are not ready.

AD_Civilian_005_011_18.speaker: Phrennog
AD_Civilian_005_011_18.text: That weird... something. I dunno - it's like a tingle in my spine I can't shake.
AD_Civilian_005_011_18.context: NodeContext: Creeped out by this weird, sixth sense kind of feeling

AD_Civilian_005_011_14.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
AD_Civilian_005_011_14.text: You sure it's not a trapped nerve?
AD_Civilian_005_011_14.context: NodeContext: Matter of factly; thinks they're being weird

AD_Civilian_005_011_4.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
AD_Civilian_005_011_4.text: So you stopped queueing because you felt funny?

AD_Civilian_005_011_16.speaker: Phrennog
AD_Civilian_005_011_16.text: I mean yes, mostly. Why did you stop queueing, then?

AD_Civilian_005_011_13.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
AD_Civilian_005_011_13.text: I couldn't take standing in that godsforsaken line a moment longer. Felt like I was gonna faint.

AD_Civilian_005_011_0.speaker: Phrennog
AD_Civilian_005_011_0.text: Fair enough. And they'd probably chuck you in the river if you did.

AD_Civilian_005_011_8.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
AD_Civilian_005_011_8.context: NodeContext: As if suddenly getting an idea

AD_Civilian_005_011_5.speaker: Phrennog
AD_Civilian_005_011_5.text: What do you mean 'what else is down there'?
AD_Civilian_005_011_5.context: NodeContext: Wondering whether they're on their side after all

AD_Civilian_005_011_11.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
AD_Civilian_005_011_11.text: I dunno. Magic, innit? I'm just saying maybe there's a reason for that weird feeling of yours.

AD_Civilian_005_011_15.speaker: Phrennog
AD_Civilian_005_011_15.context: NodeContext: Pleased that they do seem to believe

AD_Civilian_005_011_2.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
AD_Civilian_005_011_2.text: Stranger things have happened in Baldur's Gate is all I'm saying.

AD_Civilian_005_011_17.speaker: Phrennog
AD_Civilian_005_011_17.text: Think I made the right decision not to stay in line...

AD_Civilian_005_011_7.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
AD_Civilian_005_011_7.text: Do you think we could swim into the Upper City? Through the river, I mean.

AD_Civilian_005_011_10.speaker: Phrennog
AD_Civilian_005_011_10.text: Maybe. I dunno how closely they watch it.

AD_Civilian_005_011_9.speaker: Phrennog
AD_Civilian_005_011_9.text: But there's probably grates and things down there to keep trash like us out.

AD_Civilian_005_011_19.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
AD_Civilian_005_011_19.text: Nah, you're right. And I'm not the best swimmer anyway.
AD_Civilian_005_011_19.context: NodeContext: Deciding against the idea/dismissing it

AD_Civilian_005_011_6.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
AD_Civilian_005_011_6.text: Gods know what else is down there and all.

EmperorAD_EmperorWarning2_0.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
EmperorAD_EmperorWarning2_0.text: Didn't you hear me? TURN BACK.

FlamingFist_Melee_003_0.speaker: Fist Nudelmann
FlamingFist_Melee_003_0.text: Either get in line or get gone.
FlamingFist_Melee_003_0.context: NodeContext: Curt; doesn't have much patience for this any more

FlamingFist_Melee_003_1.speaker: Fist Nudelmann
FlamingFist_Melee_003_1.context: NodeContext: Curt; doesn't have much patience for this any more

FlamingFist_Cleric_001_0.speaker: Fist Healer Darbonna
FlamingFist_Cleric_001_0.text: Look, I really don't care - just get moving.

FlamingFist_Cleric_001_1.speaker: Fist Healer Darbonna
FlamingFist_Cleric_001_1.text: Dunno why you get to skip the line but go on, then.

Civilian_003_0.speaker: Saer Fleiner
Civilian_003_0.text: We'll be butchered alive when the Absolute gets here - and they won't care a fig.

Civilian_003_1.speaker: Saer Fleiner
Civilian_003_1.text: What business do they have shutting us out of the safest part of the city? There's room for everyone in there!

PAD_UpperCityHunting_5.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_5.text: I know these cobbles well - the gate to the Upper City's just ahead.

PAD_UpperCityHunting_4.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_4.text: All that time and what's my legacy in Baldur's Gate? Missing friends and broken families.

PAD_UpperCityHunting_10.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_10.text: You still have time to make a mark on the city, Astarion. You've certainly made an impression on me.

PAD_UpperCityHunting_0.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_0.text: You can't undo the past, Astarion. But you can craft a better future, if you so choose.

PAD_UpperCityHunting_1.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_1.text: You have new friendships now, Astarion, and a new family. Minsc is your friend - Boo is your brother!

PAD_UpperCityHunting_11.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_11.text: I know these cobbles well - the gate to the Upper City's just ahead.

PAD_UpperCityHunting_8.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_8.text: I found plenty of victims on the other side of that gate. Who knew they'd all come in so useful?
PAD_UpperCityHunting_8.context: NodeContext: A little smug - he killed all his victims in the ritual to ascend

PAD_UpperCityHunting_3.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_3.text: Dare I even ask the number...? Actually, no. I dare not.
PAD_UpperCityHunting_3.context: NodeContext: Apprehensive. (Astarion had alluded to his vampire victims)

PAD_UpperCityHunting_9.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_9.text: Gods. How many did you kill? Dozens? Hundreds?

PAD_UpperCityHunting_7.speaker: Player
PAD_UpperCityHunting_7.text: When Asatarion says 'victims' he means 'friends', Boo. He is a very popular man.

FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_7.speaker: Fist 'Deadeye' Mibbs
FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_7.text: Hold up - this one has special dispensation.

FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_6.speaker: Fist 'Deadeye' Mibbs
FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_6.text: Welcome to the Upper City, citizen.

FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_2.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_2.text: Do not be fooled. We are not welcome here.

FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_8.speaker: Narrator
FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_8.text: *There's something strange about this Flaming Fist's demeanour - almost as if his will is not his own.*

FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_1.speaker: Fist Healer Darbonna
FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_1.text: Look - either get in, or get back in line.

FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_9.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
FlamingFists_BeforeMainDoor_9.text: Do not do either. TURN BACK.

AD_Civilian_010_0.speaker: Grace Flamm
AD_Civilian_010_0.text: What's the use being first in line if the line's not moving?
AD_Civilian_010_0.context: NodeContext: Muttering to himself as he waits in line; a little anxious but also annoyed

AD_Civilian_010_1.speaker: Grace Flamm
AD_Civilian_010_1.context: NodeContext: Muttering to himself as he waits in line; a little anxious

FlamingFist_Melee_002_0.speaker: Fist Granitdatter
FlamingFist_Melee_002_0.text: I'm here to watch the line, not vice versa - you can look for entertainment elsewhere.
FlamingFist_Melee_002_0.context: NodeContext: No time or patience for the player's shenanigans

FlamingFist_Melee_002_1.speaker: Fist Granitdatter
FlamingFist_Melee_002_1.text: Does this look like the queue to you? Didn't think so. Now get back over there where you belong.
FlamingFist_Melee_002_1.context: NodeContext: No time or patience for the player's shenanigans

DoorDialog_14.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_14.text: You know this is not the place!

DoorDialog_10.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_10.text: The Morphic Pool is beneath the city. That is where we must go. Do not waste your time here - turn back!

DoorDialog_17.speaker: Player
DoorDialog_17.text: What happens if I keep going?

DoorDialog_16.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_16.text: You will be dominated, enthralled. It will be the end of you, the end of me.

DoorDialog_11.speaker: Player
DoorDialog_11.text: I don't care - let's go through.

DoorDialog_4.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_4.text: The Morphic Pool is beneath the city. That is where we must go. But you cannot confront the brain without all three Netherstones! Turn back!

DoorDialog_9.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_9.text: We must discover the brain's hiding place before we can attempt to confront it!

DoorDialog_13.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_13.text: The brainquakes are coming from beneath the city. We should seek it there.

DoorDialog_0.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_0.text: But you do not have all the Netherstones. You cannot defeat it without them. Turn back.

DoorDialog_18.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_18.text: It's too strong here - I can't hold it. We need to find another way!

DoorDialog_8.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_8.text: Once we go in, we'll have mere moments to reach it before we succumb, even with Orpheus' protection!

DoorDialog_6.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
DoorDialog_6.text: Did you not hear me? I said TURN BACK.

DoorDialog_12.speaker: Narrator
DoorDialog_12.text: *A powerful force emanates from beyond the door. It skims the surface of your mind with frightening speed, and recedes. You are not the one it wants.*

Civilian_007_0.speaker: Kravatt
Civilian_007_0.text: I could 'drop' my coinpurse - maybe that'd spice things up a bit.

Civilian_007_1.speaker: Kravatt
Civilian_007_1.text: Fists seem tired, don't they? Maybe some silver would perk them up - and get the line moving.

Civilian_011_0.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
Civilian_011_0.text: It's supposed to be safe past the gate - if they ever let anyone in. Bastards.
Civilian_011_0.context: NodeContext: Frustrated/weary; frustrated by the Flaming Fists

Civilian_011_1.speaker: 'Grumpo' Daggles
Civilian_011_1.text: You trying to get in too? I waited half a day and got nowhere. I gave up.

AD_FlamingFist_Melee_001_0.speaker: Fist Qirahe
AD_FlamingFist_Melee_001_0.text: Stay in line. And stop jostling!
AD_FlamingFist_Melee_001_0.context: NodeContext: Trying to keep the queue under control (somewhat aggressively)

AD_FlamingFist_Melee_001_1.speaker: Fist Qirahe
AD_FlamingFist_Melee_001_1.text: If you start fighting, you can deal with it yourselves!
AD_FlamingFist_Melee_001_1.context: NodeContext: Trying to keep the queue under control (somewhat aggressively)

Civilian_004_0.speaker: Byldrath
Civilian_004_0.text: I guess it makes things easier for them if I drop dead.

Civilian_004_1.speaker: Byldrath
Civilian_004_1.text: We've been standing in the sun all godsdamned day - Fists don't even care.

Civilian_009_0.speaker: Gardener Fillip
Civilian_009_0.text: My husband could be lying dead in the street and I still have to queue to find out!

Civilian_009_1.speaker: Gardener Fillip
Civilian_009_1.text: My husband went shopping in the Upper City days ago. I've not seen him since.

FlamingFist_Melee_004_0.speaker: Fist Grassley
FlamingFist_Melee_004_0.text: Join the queue or leave, citizen.
FlamingFist_Melee_004_0.context: NodeContext: Irritated by the player still bothering her

FlamingFist_Melee_004_1.speaker: Fist Grassley
FlamingFist_Melee_004_1.text: If you're looking to get into the Upper City, you'll need to join the queue.
FlamingFist_Melee_004_1.context: NodeContext: Matter of fact/weary - has clearly had to say this a lot today

Civilian_010_0.speaker: Grace Flamm
Civilian_010_0.text: I've never seen the Flaming Fist so on edge - what's gotten into them?
Civilian_010_0.context: NodeContext: Hushed/afraid of being overheard by the Fists

Civilian_010_1.speaker: Grace Flamm
Civilian_010_1.text: One of the Fists almost broke someone's jaw earlier - all they did was ask how long the wait was.
Civilian_010_1.context: NodeContext: Hushed/afraid of being overheard by the Fists

FlamingFist_Melee_001_0.speaker: Fist Qirahe
FlamingFist_Melee_001_0.text: Next time a fight breaks out, you can rip each other to pieces.

FlamingFist_Melee_001_1.speaker: Fist Qirahe
FlamingFist_Melee_001_1.text: Watch yourself - I'm on my third spat of the day with dogs who don't think the rules apply to them.

PAD_AfterEmperorWarning_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterEmperorWarning_0.text: We should heed the Emperor's warning. Passing the gate could be the death of us.
PAD_AfterEmperorWarning_0.context: NodeContext: Minsc line: Chastising. 'Fine, Ill ignore the Emperor and proceed until psionic force pops my skull. But one of you better clean Boo.'

AD_Civilian_008_0.speaker: Bustlebury
AD_Civilian_008_0.text: Eyes down - no need to attract attention.
AD_Civilian_008_0.context: NodeContext: Nervously/hushed; saw a guard break someone's jaw for asking a question earlier

AD_Civilian_008_1.speaker: Bustlebury
AD_Civilian_008_1.text: We'd better get in after all this.
AD_Civilian_008_1.context: NodeContext: Nervously/hushed; saw a guard break someone's jaw for asking a question earlier

FlamingFist_Caster001_0.speaker: Fist Wizard Hartlebury
FlamingFist_Caster001_0.text: Don't try and sweet talk me - I've heard it all before. Get in line.

FlamingFist_Caster001_1.speaker: Fist Wizard Hartlebury
FlamingFist_Caster001_1.text: No queue jumping. No bribes. No spitting.

Civilian_006_0.speaker: Donna Blague
Civilian_006_0.text: The whole point of a public servant is to serve the public. This isn't service - this is oppression!

Civilian_006_1.speaker: Donna Blague
Civilian_006_1.text: All these Fists just to keep us out of the Upper City. I live there! They've got no right!

AD_Civilian_001_002_0.speaker: Tuloria
AD_Civilian_001_002_0.text: What are you going to miss the most?

AD_Civilian_001_002_6.speaker: Sula Ghevora
AD_Civilian_001_002_6.context: NodeContext: Restlessly (from waiting for ages in the queue)

AD_Civilian_001_002_5.speaker: Tuloria
AD_Civilian_001_002_5.text: About not living in the Upper City after we get in.
AD_Civilian_001_002_5.context: NodeContext: Trying to make conversation; trying to be cheerful about it

AD_Civilian_001_002_4.speaker: Sula Ghevora
AD_Civilian_001_002_4.text: Being able to afford things, probably.

AD_Civilian_001_002_1.speaker: Sula Ghevora
AD_Civilian_001_002_1.text: You do realise what we're signing up for here, don't you?
AD_Civilian_001_002_1.context: NodeContext: Clearly thinks she doesn't get it (and is annoyed about it)

AD_Civilian_001_002_8.speaker: Tuloria
AD_Civilian_001_002_8.text: I'm sure we'll be able to afford things. At least the things we need.

AD_Civilian_001_002_9.speaker: Sula Ghevora
AD_Civilian_001_002_9.text: Honey, we might not be able to afford a room, let alone anything else.
AD_Civilian_001_002_9.context: NodeContext: Worried/a little annoyed she's not taking this seriously

AD_Civilian_001_002_7.speaker: Tuloria
AD_Civilian_001_002_7.text: They won't exactly let us starve to death!
AD_Civilian_001_002_7.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay upbeat despite everything

AD_Civilian_001_002_2.speaker: Sula Ghevora
AD_Civilian_001_002_2.text: You sure about that? Look what they're making us do now.
AD_Civilian_001_002_2.context: NodeContext: Annoyed at her and the queue

AD_Civilian_001_002_3.speaker: Tuloria
AD_Civilian_001_002_3.text: It'll be all right. You'll see.
AD_Civilian_001_002_3.context: NodeContext: Trying to stay upbeat still (but wavering slightly)

PAD_PsionicSupression_0.speaker: Player
PAD_PsionicSupression_0.text: My head - it feels like it's being crushed.

EmperorAD_EmperorWarning3_0.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
EmperorAD_EmperorWarning3_0.text: If you will not listen to reason, then I must act on your behalf.

Civilian_005_0.speaker: Phrennog
Civilian_005_0.text: There's something off here but I dunno what.

Civilian_005_1.speaker: Phrennog
Civilian_005_1.text: I was queuing with the others and then I started feeling... wrong. No, thanks.

EmperorAD_Brainquake_0.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
EmperorAD_Brainquake_0.text: The brain - it's here. Stay away from the gate.

Civilian_001_0.speaker: Sula Ghevora
Civilian_001_0.text: I've never seen anything like it - why can't they just let us in?

Civilian_001_1.speaker: Sula Ghevora
Civilian_001_1.text: Got gold, I hope? Most of us'll be lucky to afford a basement in the Upper City.

Civilian_002_0.speaker: Tuloria
Civilian_002_0.text: Hope we can at least rent a room inside - if this line ever moves.

Civilian_002_1.speaker: Tuloria
Civilian_002_1.text: You'd better have an inroad into the Upper City. We sold everything, but it still won't be enough.

AD_FlamingFist_Cleric_001_0.speaker: Fist Healer Darbonna
AD_FlamingFist_Cleric_001_0.text: Wait your turn! Complaining won't get you in any faster.
AD_FlamingFist_Cleric_001_0.context: NodeContext: Trying to keep the queue under control (somewhat irritated)

AD_FlamingFist_Cleric_001_1.speaker: Fist Healer Darbonna
AD_FlamingFist_Cleric_001_1.text: Single file, please - and no groups.
AD_FlamingFist_Cleric_001_1.context: NodeContext: Trying to keep the queue under control (somewhat irritated)

Civilian_008_0.speaker: Bustlebury
Civilian_008_0.text: Good luck - you could be waiting a while if you're just joining.

Civilian_008_1.speaker: Bustlebury
Civilian_008_1.text: Gods, I never thought I'd reach the front of the line.

FlamingFist_Ranger_001_0.speaker: Fist 'Deadeye' Mibbs
FlamingFist_Ranger_001_0.text: What are you waiting for? That lot would do anything to jump this queue.
FlamingFist_Ranger_001_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The player going in in this state will cause a game overNodeContext: Friendly but insistent

FlamingFist_Ranger_001_1.speaker: Fist 'Deadeye' Mibbs
FlamingFist_Ranger_001_1.text: We've been told to expect you - head on through.
FlamingFist_Ranger_001_1.context: InternalNodeContext: The player going in in this state will cause a game overNodeContext: Polite/insistent

FlamingFist_Ranger_001_2.speaker: Fist 'Deadeye' Mibbs
FlamingFist_Ranger_001_2.text: Leave! Before you have nothing left to go back to.
FlamingFist_Ranger_001_2.context: InternalNodeContext: The player will be able to control the Brain if they go in in this stateNodeContext: Menacing threat

FlamingFist_Ranger_001_3.speaker: Fist 'Deadeye' Mibbs
FlamingFist_Ranger_001_3.text: The Upper City's closed. Leave. Now.
FlamingFist_Ranger_001_3.context: InternalNodeContext: The player will be able to control the Brain if they go in in this stateNodeContext: Tense; as if his life depends on the player not passing (but trying not to show it)
